Hit Points.At Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per monk level after 1st

Proficiencies.Tools: Choose one type of artisan's tools or one musical instrument
Proficiencies.Skills: Choose two from Acrobatics, Athletics, History, Insight, Religion, and Stealth

Starting Equipment: (a) a shortsword or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

Class Features.Description: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons. All simple melee weapons and martial melee weapons with the Light property are now considered monk weapons for you. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and monk weapons. You start with a Martial Arts die of 1d6, which increases as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table. When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action.

You gain the ability to focus your ki into specific techniques. You have a number of Focus Points equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended Focus Points when you finish a long rest. Your Focus Points fuel various features:
Once per long rest, you can regain all expended Focus Points when you roll initiative.

Starting at 3rd level, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack or reduce the damage of melee attacks. The damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can spend 1 Focus Point to redirect the attack as a melee attack against a creature within 5 feet, or a ranged attack against a creature within 60 feet. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking damage equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die plus your Dexterity modifier on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
When you reach 3rd level, you commit yourself to a monastic tradition. Some of the monastic traditions include:

Starting at 5th level, you can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 Focus Point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target's speed is halved until the start of your next turn, and the next attack roll against the target has advantage. You can use this feature once per turn.
Starting at 5th level, you can choose to deal Force damage instead of Bludgeoning damage with your unarmed strikes.
At 10th level, your Focus Points improve the effectiveness of your Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, and Step of the Wind:
Starting at 10th level, you can end the charmed, frightened, or poisoned condition affecting you at the end of your turn. Additionally, you no longer need food or drink.
Starting at 13th level, your Deflect Attacks feature now applies to all damage types.
At 15th level, if you start a combat encounter with fewer than 4 Focus Points and don't use Uncanny Metabolism, you regain up to 4 Focus Points when you roll initiative.
Starting at 18th level, you can spend 3 Focus Points at the start of your turn to gain resistance to all damage types except force for 1 minute.
At 19th level, you receive one of twelve Epic Boons or another feat.
At 20th level, your dedication to self-improvement grants you mastery over your body and mind. You increase your Wisdom and Dexterity scores by 4 each, up to a maximum of 25.
